page.title: 01Adlestrop to Cornwell
page.content:
The area includes the Gloucestershire village of Adlestrop and the beautiful estate of Daylesford House (Built by Warren Hastings) and the hamlet of Daylesford. Over the boundary into Oxfordshire is the quaint village of Cornwell with its Manor House and also the substantial buildings and grounds of Kignham Hill School for boys.
The land is farmed on a sizeable scale by the estates and a few tenant and owner farmers. The agriculture is predominately arable with some dairy units of over 100 cows and one or two flocks of sheep and some horses. The woodlands range from young plantaions to belts of spectacular, mature beech. The population is fairly static. The whole area is well maintained and bears an air of some wealth.
